page.title: 12Old Graveyard, New Deer
page.content: In the old graveyard opposite St Kanes Church, New Deer there are a lot of old tombstones, some upright but many are large flagstones popular at the time of the{body-snatchers}at the end of the eighteenth century. At least one occurrence of body- snatching from New Deer is documented in the{Aberdeen Journal.}This event led to the construction of a{watch- {house}that later became a tiny {library}and finally was relegated to being used as a gravediggers shed. Traces of the building are visible at the South-eastern corner of the graveyard wall.
